resources.string:
How it works：

1、Compile *.java files to *.class class files.
2、The *.class file is compiled into a *.dex file that can be run by the Android platform through Google's R8 | D8 tool. This step can be de-sugared, and the high-version JDK syntactic sugar can be run on the Android platform. The internal implementation is basically still the syntactic sugar converted into low-version compatible code. 
3. Load the *.dex file into the application through DexClassLoader, and look for the main method reflection call. 
4. Input System.in and output of the proxy system System.out .
